title: Planning, poise and persistence: Examining Japan's four fantastic tries against Scotland
text:
Persistence was the trait that most pleased Japan head coach Jamie Joseph about his team’s 28-21 win over Scotland on Sunday. He mentioned it in more than one post-match interview.

The hosts matched intelligent pre-game planning with poise. Their discipline and measured decision-making were all the more impressive for the emotion of the occasion.

Looking back now, it is easy to forget that Scotland rocked back Japan with a series of early gang-tackles. Finn Russell then put them 7-0 ahead with seven minutes on the clock.

However, as they had done against Ireland, Japan kept the courage of their convictions. Each of their four superb tries summed up the qualities that have brought them to a Rugby...
